intro: Plagiobothrys canescens, commonly known as the graystem woollystar, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, grayish stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Plagiobothrys canescens is a perennial species that thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
